title: Austin Healey's verdict on England and South Africa's back-threes and which team has the edge
text:
England take on South Africa in Yokohama this Saturday looking to become world champions for only the second time in their history.

In the run up to the match, our experts will be taking a look at the key positions and where the teams' strengths and weaknesses lay. In part one, former England and British & Irish Lion Austin Healey takes a look at the back-threes.

England

Quite a few people have called for Elliot Daly to be moved from full-back, but I do not think he has let anyone down at this World Cup. Equally, I would not say we have seen the best of him yet either. There is more to come.

However, what I have been really impressed with is Daly's positioning. There have been very few high balls...
description: England take on South Africa in Yokohama this Saturday looking to become world champions for only the second time in their history.
